item.title: Building transactional email workflows with Drupal and Mandrill
item.author: michaeledenfield@gmail.com (Eddie Edenfield)
item.description: At Open Angler, transactional texts and emails are an important part of how we facilitate and improve upon the process of booking a charter boat or fishing trip online. Most web frameworks like Drupal have built in methods and modules to handle sending email, but plaintext is the default, and it’s done from the same server you host your website, generally speaking. So let’s improve upon that. This is specific to Drupal, but the general process is likely similar.

item.title: Integrating Drupal 7 platform with Slack
item.author: michaeledenfield@gmail.com (Eddie Edenfield)
item.description: At Open Angler, we need to know when booking requests happen on our site. In the old days, a site manager might log in to a dashboard periodically, or perhaps get an email based on a customer action. These days, a push notification is probably better if time is of the essence. We love Slack, and decided the easiest way to achieve our goal would be to just set up a simple bot that posts to a dedicated channel whenever a new booking request is created.

item.title: hello world
item.author: michaeledenfield@gmail.com (Eddie Edenfield)
item.description: Hello world! This is my a personal project and portfolio site where I intend to write about new things I’m learning about programming and code. I will also revisit things I’ve created that I’m proud about and want to display publicly. Much of what is contained will be about challenging myself to accomplish X using something new, and then writing about it. For this site, I went with Hugo - a static site generator written in Go.
